title: ak34
author: ak34
content: ...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank you

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: ak34 on November 12, 2023, 06:18:35 PM...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank youMost of the airdrop is unannounced and retroactive to reward user that is genuinely supporting a certain project in the form of various task such as staking, running a node, trade and etc. It’s very hard to determine exact airdrop date but some website like https://boxmining.com/upcoming-crypto-airdrops/ gives you a list of project that has the potential to have an airdrop but again some of them is not guaranteed.You will need to risk completing the task without any guarantee for an airdrop. It requires some spending and this is now the format of airdrops.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: ak34 on November 12, 2023, 06:18:35 PM...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank youI know, but the thing with this airdrop is that most of them are un-announce or they are going to make it to the public in just a couple of days. So you should follow them on their official social media like Twitter as they usually put their announcement there.But just be careful though, as scammers also had this kind of knowledge and so they will create a similar websites with celestia or any other projects that will airdrop soon and then asking you to connect your wallet. Do not do that as the criminals will scoop every tokens from you and drain everything.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Quote from: ak34 on November 12, 2023, 06:18:35 PM...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank youThere's no one website to keep track of upcoming airdrops. The best strategy I've seen so far is to be a part of a community where latest information about such events / announcements are posted by other members. This way you won't be a lot if you're active as there are most eyes on new opportunities and announcements as they become available. You should get onnit asap as more drops might be on the way —see zksync and layerzero (heavily rumored in recent times).

comments.author: JeffBrad12
comments.body: trust me these kind of retroactive airdrop would never ever make announcement about anything because many reasons.the history of retroactive airdrop is always like that never announcing but suddenly giving out reward with certain criteria so that most of people would find the information themselves and do anything to fulfil that criteria and requirements to be qualified for the airdrop which is additional effort for no additional reward exactly what the devs has been wanting from the very start.you might find the information about such airdrop on telegram channel or something like that but usually its just rumours but rumours indeed can be a fact later on.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: Quote from: ak34 on November 12, 2023, 06:18:35 PM...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank youYou have missed the train. That's sad that if your allocated TIA has already redistributed to the eligible participants who have been claiming their tokens. There are so many websites to know the potential projects that may do another airdrop. I will mention somedropstabCryptorankThese websites will give you information regarding what potential projects that may do airdrop in the future. It must be noted that if you must put VC who backed the project as the main concern. It's caused by any legit airdrops will always be backed by the big parties and venture capital. I think that majority of people agree with this. It's caused by any projects backed by binance labs will always be doing airdrop.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: ak34 on November 12, 2023, 06:18:35 PM...looks like i missed the train having atom and osmo ...are there any websites to check what and when airdrops coming ? can someone disappoint me how much i missed (tia per atom or osmo)thank youWell much better if you follow some OG on twittet if theres an airdrop on cosmos and osmo. Usually they are posting it especially the upcoming. Theres a tier of received airdrop from tia but almost all have the same equal tokens with the lowest tier I think 163 tokens of tia before it was only 50 tia but increase 3x.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: There were 4 criterias, about github one I'm not sure but for evm/atom/osmo you would have minimum gotten 161 $TIA. Regarding staying up to date with airdrops I can tell my sources. 1) https://twitter.com/OlimpioCrypto2) https://t.me/ChasetheChallenge3) https://t.me/airdropofficial7
